{"title": "Pac-Mania", "title_search": "pacmania", "title_keyword": "pacmania", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/pac-mania/", "summary": "Celebrate PAC-MAN’s 30th anniversary by joining him in three-dimensions! Namco is proud to reintroduce PAC-MANIA, the fan-favorite game that pits PAC-MAN against ghosts new and old in unique and addictive 3D worlds!  Injecting fresh life into the best-loved elements of classic PAC-MAN, PAC-MANIA introduces amazing 3D abilities such as the power to jump over ghosts! But the dot-chomping, power-pellet adventure that has long-defined PAC-MAN has new foes to match its new powers and dimensions: introducing Funky and Spunky, two new ghosts who won't just chase PAC-MAN but hop like he does!  With 2 modes and 4 unique worlds, this twist on classic PAC-MAN will make you a PAC-MANIAC!  Features - PAC-MANIA's introduction of isometric 3D preserves the best-loved elements of classic PAC-MAN while introducing totally new 3D abilities! - Jump over ghosts and change direction mid-air for an entirely new PAC-MAN experience! - Newcomers Funky and Spunky can hop too, adding a new dimension of ghostly trouble for PAC-MAN! - Four unique worlds including Block Town, PAC-MAN’s Park, Sandbox Land and Jungle Steps provide a variety of challenges! - Play in Original Mode or enter Scramble Mode, where PAC-MAN has 120 seconds to rack up the highest score possible and each PAC-DOT consumed makes him move faster! - With 23 stages of gameplay, are you a big enough maniac to take the challenge? - Use your iPhone/iPod touch to take control of PAC-MAN via Virtual Pad, Touch, or Flick controls! - Earn achievements and compete against others via leaderboards inside the Game Center!", "genre": ["Arcade"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2010-11-25", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-172988-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-172988-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": ["St. Daimyojin (Directed By)", "Toru Iwatani (Directed By)", "Yuriko Keino (Music)", "Junko Ozawa (Music)", "Yoshito Tomuro (Music)", "Yuriko Keino (Sound: sound)", "Paul S. {"title": "Star Trek: Judgment Rites", "title_search": "star trek judgment rites", "title_keyword": "star trek judgment rites", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/star-trek-judgment-rites/", "summary": "Captain's log, stardate 6238.4. There is no doubt that you're being watched. By whom and by what type of life form is not determined. Even Spock has not been able to accurately assess this data. The occurrences are just too strange.\r Is that truly an ancient WW1 triplane heading straight for you at Warp 9? Could it be Trelane? How can your sensors suddenly report life forms on a dead planet? Where did that primitive race get such advanced technology? No, it couldn't be Dr. Bredell and the Vardaine ... he was thought dead from your last encounter.\r The tension increases as you beam down to mysterious worlds and encounter strange adversaries in situations that simply defy logic.\r You're a long way from Starfleet Command and only you can discover what-or who-is challenging you beyond your wildest nightmares. {"title": "The Witness (1983)", "title_search": "the witness 1983", "title_keyword": "the witness 1983", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/the-witness-1983/", "summary": "FEBRUARY 1938, LOS ANGELES. FDR's New Deal is finally rolling. Hitler's rolling, too; this time through Austria. But as Chief Detective for a quiet burgh on the outskirts of L.A., you've got other fish to fry.\r One gilt-edged society dame is dead. And now it looks like some two-bit grifter is putting the screws to her multi-millionaire old man. Then you step in, and the shakedown turns ugly.
